Module paceManager
Package app

Class Settings

java.lang.Object
app.Settings
public class Settings
extends java.lang.Object
Class containing all current settings of the program. Stores these values in a location dependent on the operating system. Or at least that is what it's supposed to do.
Since:
1.0.0
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Thomas Kwashnak

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private boolean aggressiveMemorySave
    Determines whether additional steps are taken to reduce memory used by the program.
    private boolean aggressiveSave
    Whether to automatically save the file whenever any changes to the Pace have been saved.
    private java.lang.String[] fileExtensions
    What the file extension should be for files opened by the program.
    private java.lang.String paceDirectory
    Default directory to begin looking for pace files in
    private java.util.List<java.lang.String> recentFiles
    List of recently opened Pace files
    static java.io.File settingsFile
    File object referencing to where the Settings JSON is stored
    private java.lang.String version
    Current application version of the settings object

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Settings()
    Creates a new Settings object and sets values to their defaults.

  • Method Details

    • save

      public void save()
      Saves the current configuration
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • isAggressiveMemorySave

      public boolean isAggressiveMemorySave()
      Returns whether to aggressively save memory (ram)
      Returns:
      true if the setting is set to true, false if the setting is set to false
      Since:
      1.0.0
      See Also:
      aggressiveMemorySave

    • setAggressiveMemorySave

      public void setAggressiveMemorySave​(boolean value)
      Sets whether the program should be concerned about aggressively saving values

      Will save settings to the settings file after the modification

      Parameters:
      value - true if the program should take extra steps to reduce memory, false if not
      Since:
      1.0.0
      See Also:
      aggressiveMemorySave

    • getFileExtensions

      public java.lang.String[] getFileExtensions()
      Gets the list of file extensions used when opening a pace file
      Returns:
      String array of valid file extensions. Extensions are in the format .___.
      Since:
      1.0.0
      See Also:
      fileExtensions

    • setFileExtensions

      public void setFileExtensions​(java.lang.String[] fileExtensions)
      Sets the list of file extensions.

      Will save settings to the settings file after the modification

      Parameters:
      fileExtensions - String array of valid file extensions. Extensions are in the format .___.
      Since:
      1.0.0
      See Also:
      fileExtensions

    • getPaceDirectory

      public java.lang.String getPaceDirectory()
      Gets the pace directory path string
      Returns:
      String Path of the default directory to begin looking for pace files in
      Since:
      1.0.0
      See Also:
      paceDirectory

    • setPaceDirectory

      public void setPaceDirectory​(java.lang.String directory)
      Sets the pace directory

      Will save settings to the settings file after the modification

      Parameters:
      directory - String Path of the default directory to begin looking for pace files in
      Since:
      1.0.0
      See Also:
      paceDirectory

    • getRecentFiles

      public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getRecentFiles()
      Returns a list of recently opened pace files
      Returns:
      List of recently opened files stored as strings of the file locations
      Since:
      1.0.0
      See Also:
      recentFiles

    • addRecentFile

      public void addRecentFile​(java.lang.String path)
      Adds a new recent file to the list of recent files if that file is not already listed

      Will save settings to the settings file after the modification

      Parameters:
      path - String Path representation of the new file to add
      Since:
      1.0.0
      See Also:
      recentFiles

    • cleanRecentFiles

      public void cleanRecentFiles()
      Clears the list of recently opened pace files

      Will save settings to the settings file after the modification

      Since:
      1.0.0
      See Also:
      recentFiles

    • isAggressiveSave

      public boolean isAggressiveSave()
      Returns whether to aggressively save the pace file whenever a modification has been made to it
      Returns:
      true if a pace object should attempt to save whenever a modification ping is sent to it, false otherwise
      Since:
      1.0.0
      See Also:
      aggressiveSave

    • setAggressiveSave

      public void setAggressiveSave​(boolean aggressiveSave)
      Sets whether to aggressively save the pace file whenever a modification has been made to it

      Will save settings to the settings file after the modification

      Parameters:
      aggressiveSave - true if a pace object should attempt to save whenever a modification ping is sent to it, false otherwise
      Since:
      1.0.0
      See Also:
      aggressiveSave
